results.title: The Coolangatta Gold
results.creator_credit: Igor Auzins, John Weiley, Hoyts and Michael Edgley International
results.brief_description: A young son is filled with burning resentment at being forced to live in his brother’s shadow. His brother is burdened by their father’s desire for glory. Their father is obsessed by the need to redeem his own failure twenty years before. A dramatic story of family conflict which culminates in the spectacular excitement of the greatest beach and surf triaquathon in the world, the Coolangatta Gold. Both brothers enter the race, one to win for his father, one bent to beat his father. To do so, they must also compete against each other. Cast: Joss McWilliam, Nick Tate, Robyn Nevin, Josephine Smulders, Colin Friels.

results.title: Turmoil [game trailer]
results.brief_description:
This challenging platform game takes place in the year 3000, amid environmental chaos. Your task is to deliver the final piece of a time machine that will allow scientists to travel to the past to introduce sustainable thinking practices.

This trailer illustrates how the game is played.

results.title: Bins vs. Rubbish [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Auburn Primary School, Ari Kritzerseferi, Harry Dempsey, Jordan Trieu and Luc Thompson
results.brief_description:
A short excerpt from a computer game created for the 2010 ‘Screen It’ competition. This fun strategy game lets you dodge, catch and shoot rubbish. The message is to stop littering, as it can hurt animals and increase global warming.

This trailer illustrates how the game is played.

results.title: Anthony Lucas talks about 'The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle'
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Oscar nominated animator Anthony Lucas (‘The Mysterious Geographic Explorations of Jasper Morello’) speaks candidly about his creative processes and inspirations. He introduces his latest work, ‘The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle’, commissioned for ACMI’s ‘Screen Worlds’ exhibition. He takes us on a creative adventure from beginning to end, starting with initial ideas and inspiration, right through to the creation of the on-screen animation and mechanised components.
results.title_for_label: Anthony Lucas talks about ‘The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle’

results.title: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

video_links.name: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

results.brief_description: Michael Connor, Consultant Curator of ‘Screen Worlds: The Story of Film, Television and Digital Culture’, is in conversation with Conrad Bodman, ACMI’s Head of Exhibitions. Connor discusses both the overall concept and the separate sections of the exhibition. Connor and Bodman discuss some of the challenges of choosing, sourcing and exhibiting over a hundred years of creative work and technology relating to the moving image.
results.title_for_label: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

results.title: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

video_links.name: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

results.brief_description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation. Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.
results.description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation.
